text.__SUMMARY__: Odostomia plicata is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The thin shell is transparent and polished. Its length measures 2.5 mm. It is marked with microscopic spiral striae. Its color is very pale yellowish white or white, darker at the suture. There are 5 to 6 whorls in the teleoconch. The sutures are moderately impressed. There is no umbilicus or a narrow chink in full-grown specimens. The columellar tooth is small, but distinct.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
British Isles
European waters (ERMS scope)
Greek Exclusive Economic Zone
Irish Exclusive economic Zone
Portuguese Exclusive Economic Zone
South West Coast of Apulia
Spanish Exclusive Economic Zone
United Kingdom Exclusive Economic Zone
